metadata.title: CVE-2022-46883 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla developers Gabriele Svelto, Yulia Startsev, Andrew McCreight andthe Mozilla Fuzzing Team reported memory safety bugs present in Firefox106. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presumethat with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to runarbitrary code.
*Note*: This advisory was added on December 13th, 2022after discovering it was inadvertently left out of the original advisory.The fix was included in the original release of Firefox 107. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 107.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
